speaker: Zoe
text: If we finish testing by Thursday, we will be able to release the new feature on Friday.
ipa: ɪf wi ˈfɪnɪʃ ˈtɛstɪŋ baɪ ˈθɝzdeɪ | wi wɪl bi ˈeɪbəl tu rɪˈlis ðə nu ˈfiʧɚ ɑn ˈfɹaɪdeɪ
stress: IF we FINISH TESTING by THURSDAY | we WILL be ABLE to RELEASE the NEW FEATURE on FRIDAY
linking:
"finish testing" → /ˈfɪnɪʃ ˈtɛstɪŋ/ (sh + t linking)
"release the" → /rɪˈlis ðə/ (s + th linking)

speaker: Carlos
text: Yeah, and if QA finds any blockers, we will have to push it to next week.
ipa: jæ | ənd ɪf ˈkjuːˈeɪ faɪndz ˈɛni ˈblɑkɚz | wi wɪl hæv tu pʊʃ ɪt tu nɛkst wik
stress: YEAH | and IF QA FINDS any BLOCKERS | we WILL HAVE to PUSH it to NEXT WEEK
linking:
"push it" → /pʊʃ ɪt/ (sh + i linking)
"to next" → /tu nɛkst/ (u + n linking)

speaker: Zoe
text: Right. If the performance tests pass, I will write the final release notes that same day.
ipa: ɹaɪt | ɪf ðə pɚˈfɔɹməns tɛsts pæs | aɪ wɪl ɹaɪt ðə ˈfaɪnəl rɪˈlis noʊts ðæt seɪm deɪ
stress: RIGHT | IF the PERFORMANCE TESTS PASS | I WILL WRITE the FINAL RELEASE NOTES that SAME DAY
linking:
"write the" → /ɹaɪt ðə/ (t + th linking)
"release notes" → /rɪˈlis noʊts/ (s + n linking)

speaker: Carlos
text: Cool. If I get feedback from the product team today, I will apply the changes before 6 p.m.
ipa: kul | ɪf aɪ ɡɛt ˈfidˌbæk fɹəm ðə ˈpɹɑdʌkt tim təˈdeɪ | aɪ wɪl əˈplaɪ ðə ˈʧeɪnʤɪz bɪˈfɔɹ sɪks pi ɛm
stress: COOL | IF I GET FEEDBACK from the PRODUCT TEAM TODAY | I WILL APPLY the CHANGES BEFORE SIX P.M.
linking:
"get feedback" → /ɡɛt ˈfidˌbæk/ (t + f linking)
"apply the" → /əˈplaɪ ðə/ (y + th linking)

speaker: Zoe
text: Perfect. But if the security review isn’t complete by tomorrow, we won’t launch on time.
ipa: ˈpɝfɪkt | bʌt ɪf ðə sɪˈkjʊɹəti ɹɪˈvju ɪzənt kəmˈplit baɪ təˈmɑɹoʊ | wi woʊnt lɔntʃ ɑn taɪm
stress: PERFECT | BUT IF the SECURITY REVIEW ISN’T COMPLETE by TOMORROW | we WON’T LAUNCH on TIME
linking:
"review isn’t" → /ɹɪˈvju ɪzənt/ (w + i linking)
"launch on" → /lɔntʃ ɑn/ (ch + o linking)

speaker: Carlos
text: Totally. And if we miss this window, marketing will have to redo their campaign schedule again.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli | ənd ɪf wi mɪs ðɪs ˈwɪndoʊ | ˈmɑɹkɪtɪŋ wɪl hæv tu ˌɹiˈdu ðɛɹ kæmˈpeɪn ˈskɛʤuəl əˈɡɛn
stress: TOTALLY | AND IF we MISS this WINDOW | MARKETING will HAVE to REDO their CAMPAIGN SCHEDULE AGAIN
linking:
"miss this" → /mɪs ðɪs/ (s + th linking)
"redo their" → /ˌɹiˈdu ðɛɹ/ (u + th linking)

speaker: Zoe
text: True. Also, if we stay late tonight, we might finish early and have Friday free.
ipa: tɹu | ˈɔlsoʊ | ɪf wi steɪ leɪt təˈnaɪt | wi maɪt ˈfɪnɪʃ ˈɝli ənd hæv ˈfɹaɪdeɪ fɹi
stress: TRUE | ALSO | IF we STAY LATE TONIGHT | we MIGHT FINISH EARLY and HAVE FRIDAY FREE
linking:
"stay late" → /steɪ leɪt/ (y + l linking)
"finish early" → /ˈfɪnɪʃ ˈɝli/ (sh + e linking)

speaker: Carlos
text: That would be nice. But if we rush the final tests, we risk breaking production.
ipa: ðæt wʊd bi naɪs | bʌt ɪf wi ɹʌʃ ðə ˈfaɪnəl tɛsts | wi ɹɪsk ˈbɹeɪkɪŋ pɹəˈdʌkʃən
stress: THAT would be NICE | BUT IF we RUSH the FINAL TESTS | we RISK BREAKING PRODUCTION
linking:
"rush the" → /ɹʌʃ ðə/ (sh + th linking)
"breaking production" → /ˈbɹeɪkɪŋ pɹəˈdʌkʃən/ (g + p linking)

speaker: Zoe
text: Good point. Let’s do it right — if we communicate well, the team will handle the rollout smoothly.
ipa: ɡʊd pɔɪnt | lɛts du ɪt ɹaɪt — ɪf wi kəˈmjunɪkeɪt wɛl | ðə tim wɪl ˈhændəl ðə ˈɹoʊˌlaʊt ˈsmuðli
stress: GOOD POINT | LET’S DO it RIGHT — IF we COMMUNICATE WELL | the TEAM will HANDLE the ROLLOUT SMOOTHLY
linking:
"do it" → /du ɪt/ (u + i linking)
"handle the" → /ˈhændəl ðə/ (l + th linking)
